docs.snippet: On the same day Facebook bought ads in U.S. and British newspapers to apologize for the Cambridge Analytica scandal, the social media site faced new questions about collecting phone numbers and text messages from Android devices.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Faces Scrutiny for Pulling Android Call, Text Data
headline.main: Facebook Faces Scrutiny for Pulling Android Call, Text Data

docs.snippet: U.S. auto parts retailer Pep Boys said on Monday it is suspending all advertising on Facebook Inc following concerns of data privacy, joining internet company Mozilla Corp in pulling ads from the social networking site.

headline.print_headline: Pep Boys Suspends Facebook Ads After Data Security Breach
headline.main: Pep Boys Suspends Facebook Ads After Data Security Breach

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc said on Monday it would expand its local news push beyond the United States to provide users with more stories from local sources covering their current cities and other cities of interest.

headline.print_headline: Facebook to Expand Its Local News Feature Beyond U.S.
headline.main: Facebook to Expand Its Local News Feature Beyond U.S.

docs.snippet: Facebook is giving its privacy tools a makeover as it reels from criticisms over its data practices and faces tighter European regulations in the coming months.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Revamps Privacy Tools as Tighter EU Rules Draw Near
headline.main: Facebook Revamps Privacy Tools as Tighter EU Rules Draw Near

docs.snippet: The Latest on Facebook's data collection from members (all times local):

headline.print_headline: The Latest: Facebook Questioned About Scraping Phone Data
headline.main: The Latest: Facebook Questioned About Scraping Phone Data

docs.snippet: New Zealand's privacy commissioner joined international criticism against Facebook Inc, saying on Wednesday it has broken the law by declining a citizen access to personal information held on the accounts of other users.

headline.print_headline: New Zealand Privacy Commissioner Joins Criticism of Facebook Data Handling
headline.main: New Zealand Privacy Commissioner Joins Criticism of Facebook Data Handling

docs.snippet: Three users of the Facebook Messenger app sued Facebook on Tuesday, saying the social network violated their privacy by collecting logs of their phone calls and text messages, in the latest legal challenge facing the company.

headline.print_headline: Three Facebook Users Sue Over Collection of Call, Text History
headline.main: Three Facebook Users Sue Over Collection of Call, Text History

docs.snippet: Mozilla, Tesla and other companies are distancing themselves from Facebook following revelations of a major leak of user data to political consultants associated with the 2016 Trump campaign.

headline.print_headline: Mozilla, Tesla, Other Businesses Take a Facebook Pause
headline.main: Mozilla, Tesla, Other Businesses Take a Facebook Pause

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc chief executive Mark Zuckerberg will appear before the U.S. Congress to answer questions on data privacy and other issues, but it is not clear to which committee or committees he will testify, a source briefed on the matter said on Tu...

headline.print_headline: Facebook CEO Plans to Testify Before U.S. Congress: Source
headline.main: Facebook CEO Plans to Testify Before U.S. Congress: Source

docs.snippet: As questions mounted last year about whether Facebook had been exploited to tilt the U.S. presidential election, Mark Zuckerberg's to-do list landed him on a fishing trawler off Alabama's Gulf coast.

headline.print_headline: Is Zuckerberg Willing to Act Boldly to Fix Facebook Crisis?
headline.main: Is Zuckerberg Willing to Act Boldly to Fix Facebook Crisis?
